used as a reagent to separate out coal or ores of metal in an industrial floatation process;
used in pipeline pigging;
used in down-hole operations at a well site;
used to remove natural gas liquids or impurities in the processing of natural gas;
used as a refrigerant in a closed system in the processing of natural gas;
used as anti-freeze in a natural gas pipeline.

subsection.subsectiontext: If the director is satisfied that coke, high heat value coal, low heat value coal, petroleum coke or a combination of them was combusted as a reductant in the production of lead, the director must, on application, pay the applicant a refund of the tax paid in respect of the coke, high heat value coal, low heat value coal or petroleum coke equal to the amount set out in column 1 of the table multiplied by the number of tonnes of lead produced using the coke, high heat value coal, low heat value coal, petroleum coke or a combination of them as a reductant purchased during the period set out in column 3 of the table.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Calculation of interest if assessment exceeds refund

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: This section applies to the calculation of interest under section 55 (1) of the Act if

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the director makes an assessment of an amount against a person under section 45 (1) or (2) of the Act,

the director has determined that the person referred to in paragraph (a) is entitled to a refund under the Act in respect of taxes paid or remitted or security paid during the period of time considered by the director in making the assessment referred to in paragraph (a),

prior to the director's giving notice of the assessment for the amount referred to in paragraph (a), the application for the refund that is required by the Act is made by the person but the refund is not yet made, and
the amount referred to in paragraph (a) is equal to or exceeds the amount of the refund referred to in paragraph (b).

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: In the circumstances set out in subsection (1), the director must calculate interest on the amount referred to in subsection (1) (a) as follows:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: by calculating the interest, in the manner set out in section 36 and at the rate prescribed under the Interest Rate Under Various Statutes Regulation, B.C. Reg. 386/92, on each of the following:

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the amount referred to in subsection (1) (a);

the amount of the refund referred to in subsection (1) (b) as if that amount were an amount of tax or security assessed against the person on the date that the person remitted or paid the tax or security that resulted in the person's entitlement to the refund;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: by subtracting the amount calculated under paragraph (a) (ii) from the amount calculated under paragraph (a) (i);

by calculating the interest payable on the amount of the refund referred to in subsection (1) (b) in the manner and at the rate prescribed under the Interest on Overdue Accounts Payable Regulation, B.C. Reg. 215/83;
by adding the amount calculated under paragraph (c) to the amount calculated under paragraph (b).

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If the amount calculated under subsection (2) (d) is a negative amount, the interest on the amount referred to in subsection (1) (a) is zero.

change.changenote: Section 38 BEFORE repealed by BC Reg 116/2014, effective June 23, 2014.
